data.title: Grey’s Anatomy Season 21: Here’s when Meredith Grey and team will return on ABC
data.meta_description: The beloved medical drama "Greys Anatomy" has wrapped up its 20th season, leaving fans eagerly anticipating the return of Meredith Grey and her colleagues at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital.
data.text:
Synopsis

The beloved medical drama "Grey’s Anatomy" has wrapped up its 20th season, leaving fans eagerly anticipating the return of Meredith Grey and her colleagues at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital.

The beloved medical drama Grey’s Anatomy concluded its 20th season, leaving fans eagerly anticipating the return of Meredith Grey and her colleagues at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital. As the curtain falls on this season, viewers are left wondering: When will Grey’s Anatomy Season 21 premiere on ABC?

Season Finale Recap

Tonight’s Finale:

The 20th season finale of Grey’s Anatomy, titled “Burn It Down,” aired on ABC, as mentioned in a report by Decider. The episode centers around a series of wildfires threatening Seattle, leading to an overwhelming influx of patients at the hospital.

According to ABC, the doctors are seen managing overcapacity in the ER, performing complex surgeries, and dealing with personal stress. Meanwhile, Meredith Grey makes a crucial decision that could have lasting consequences.

How to Watch

Streaming the Finale:

For those wanting to catch the finale live, it will be available on ABC, the ABC app, or ABC.com with a valid cable login. Additionally, cord-cutters can stream the episode through services like fuboTV, Hulu + Live TV, YouTube TV, Sling TV, or DirecTV Stream. Free trials are available for new subscribers on some of these platforms, as per a report by Decider.

Next-Day Streaming:

If you miss the live broadcast, the season finale will be available for next-day streaming on Hulu and ABC.com starting Friday, May 31. All episodes of Grey’s Anatomy are currently available on Hulu, making it easy for fans to catch up.

Renewal and Future

Season 21 Confirmation:

In April 2024, ABC officially renewed Grey’s Anatomy for its 21st season. This renewal ensures that fans will continue to enjoy high-stakes medical drama and intricate character arcs that have become synonymous with the show.

Premiere Date Speculation:

While the exact premiere date for Season 21 has not been announced, Grey’s Anatomy is included in ABC’s 2024 fall schedule. Historically, new seasons debut in late September. It is anticipated that Grey’s Anatomy Season 21 will premiere around Thursday, September 26, 2024, as per a report by Decider.

Additional Information

Netflix Release:

For those who prefer to binge-watch, Seasons 1-19 of Grey’s Anatomy are available on Netflix in the United States. The release pattern suggests that Season 20 will likely be added to Netflix by the end of June 2024. Previous seasons have typically been available on Netflix within a month of their finale airing on ABC.

FAQs

Will there be a season 21 of Grey's Anatomy?

“The loyalty and love of Grey's Anatomy fans have propelled us into a historic 21st season, and I could not be more grateful,” series creator Shonda Rhimes said in a statement to The Hollywood Reporter following the renewal announcement.

How many episodes will be in season 21 of Grey's Anatomy?

"Grey's Anatomy" shows no signs of ending anytime soon. After the season finale, the series will return to ABC in the fall. The network has renewed the show for its 21st season, which, according to Deadline, could feature 18 episodes.
